pageContext.description: Metal perfectly preserved and spring is well retained. Edges have been rubbed perfectly true.
pageContext.patina: Deep brown patina and flecked apple green. Lustrous patina.
pageContext.associations: Bronze Age pottery (Identified by R. Smith Esq, FSA) and charcoal, animal bones, flint implements, rubbing and polishing stones, sandstons, and whetstone.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,A. Leslie Armstrong, Esq.,14 Swaledale Rd., Sheffield
pageContext.site: England,Norfolk,Weeting,Grimes Graves (Floor 85),17 Sept. 1920,Found by the owner on edge of bronze age hearth 9 ft. below present surface. Similar to fig. 299, Evans' "B.A.I."
pageContext.toSearch: Grimes Graves Visitors Centre, Thetford Forest Park, Lynford, Thetford, Norfolk Ip26 5de, UK
